thread.title: No Netflix, no selfies at Cannes Film Festival this year

author: Reuters Editorial
title: No Netflix, no selfies at Cannes Film Festival this year
text:
PARIS (Reuters) - The Cannes Film Festival will ban Netflix from this year’s event after the video-on-demand company stood firm in its refusal to give its movies a cinema release, festival director Thierry Fremaux said in an interview.
FILE PHOTO: 70th Cannes Film Festival - Cannes, France. 16/05/2017 - A Chopard representative displays the Palme d'Or, the highest prize awarded to competing films, during an interview before the start of the festival. REUTERS/Regis Duvignau/File Photo Red-carpet selfies will also be banned.
Two Netflix films were screened in Cannes last year but organizers had said the company would not be allowed to compete at the festival again if it did not show them in movie halls.
“Last year, when we selected two of their movies, I thought I could convince Netflix to release them in theaters. I was presumptuous: they refused,” Fremaux told magazine Le Film Francais.
“The people at Netflix loved the red carpet and would like to show us more movies. But they have understood that their intransigence over their (business) model clashes with our own.”
FILE PHOTO: 70th Cannes Film Festival - Screening of the film the film "The Square" in competition - Red Carpet Arrivals - Cannes, France. 20/05/2017. A couple of guests takes a selfie on the red carpet. REUTERS/Jean-Paul Pelissier/File Photo However, Netflix may be permitted to show movies on the fringe of the festival, outside the official competition, he said.
Meanwhile, the festival’s decision to blacklist selfies taken by members of the audience on the red carpet caused a stir. Fremaux said selfies created a “mess”.
Asked if that decision was outdated and old fashioned, Fremaux said: “No, it’s quite the opposite, and you’ll see, others will follow suit.” Selfies, he said, “go against what has made Cannes’ reputation. A certain elegance, discretion.”
Fremaux also said he was ending the press screening of movies before their world premiere in the official competition. The official selection for the May 8-19 festival will be announced on April 12th, he said.
Australian movie star Cate Blanchett will head the jury this year.
Reporting by Ingrid Melander; Editing by Richard Lough
